root: ^Ah, a visitor to our most sacred grove. How can the dying star guide you, wanderer?

c-0: ^Indeed, [[class]]. Selandris, the Dying Star, is still mother to this garden we call home. She once provided all we needed to flourish. And one day, will again.

c-3: ^Dying, not dead. Even in her slumbering state, her strength eclipses that of the false sun burning the heavens like a prideful usurper.

sun: ^Our oath is to Selandris. The followers of Darkness and those blindly following the false sun are equally irrelevant to us [[class]].

c-5: ^Yes, this… abomination in the sky. It is as loathsome as the demons that now abuse the Garden's hospitality. A lifeless substitute fueling the endless wars that destroyed more than we could ever hope to rebuild.

^The intense expression on the druids’ features fades into a thin, reverent smile. "Selandris represented nuance, the shade in which one could rest, the soothing light to provide all the sustenance one needed. Her twilight offered balance, not judgment."

murders: ^Murders? Mutilations? It sounds like these trespassers have fallen prey to some animal. These wilds can be hazardous to those without Selandris’ blessing.

c-6: ^The druid shrugs. "Who knows what abomination has wandered too far from the battlefield. These are chaotic times."

leave: ^I assure you, traveler, pressing this matter will not yield you the clarity you search for on behalf of your masters. Return to them and leave us be.
